repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

body:
Problem: When isIncomplete is true, subsequent input will continue to send requests. The prefix is always taken from the column where the request was triggered, which causes matches to be empty. and there is missing handle item.textEdit.

Solution: if word not match using filterText as word and accept textEdit, When Context.cusror have value use it for prefix sub

Now 
![test](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/4fffea55-b027-4db2-aefd-2bcce264baf3)


After
![test1](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/56e60c04-8ce5-4f72-9d61-ffd4e0109298)

comment_data.body:
```suggestion
  if tonumber(vim.fn.pumvisible()) == 1 and not Context.isIncomplete then
```

This looks unrelated?
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -441,7 +445,7 @@ local function trigger(bufnr, clients)
   reset_timer()
   Context:cancel_pending()
 
-  if tonumber(vim.fn.pumvisible()) == 1 and not Context.isIncomplete then
+  if tonumber(vim.fn.pumvisible()) == 1 then

comment_data.body: if keep there , continuing input will clean pum `wp.` then input w. pum is cleaned

comment_data.body:
But isn't removing it breaking the functionality to fetch more results if the initial results were incomplete?
Is there some state hiccup that causes isIncomplete to have the wrong value?

comment_data.body: clangd returns isInComplete true but subsequent input clangd returns empty results. a bit strange ðŸ¤”

comment_data.body: Maybe worth reporting upstream with clangd? In the meantime we could instead guard the `vim.fn.complete(start_col, matches)` and call it only if there are matches given that we rely on the pum mechanism to do the filtering we don't need a response to "wipe out" any shown candidates.

comment_data.body: Should Context.isIncomplete be bound to the client? If one client returns isIncomplete: false, should we still send requests from all clients?
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -441,7 +445,7 @@ local function trigger(bufnr, clients)
   reset_timer()
   Context:cancel_pending()
 
-  if tonumber(vim.fn.pumvisible()) == 1 and not Context.isIncomplete then
+  if tonumber(vim.fn.pumvisible()) == 1 then

comment_data.body:
> Should Context.isIncomplete be bound to the client? If one client returns isIncomplete: false, should we still send requests from all clients?

A bit tricky,  ideally we'd fetch & replace the results per client, but that would mean in addition to https://github.com/neovim/neovim/issues/32428 and an extended `complete_add` we'd also need to be able to either remove results (e.g. remove previous results for client-2, add new results for client-2, but keep results from client-1) or a way to replace namespaces results?

Independent of that, do I understand it right that this PR is otherwise good to go?
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -441,7 +445,7 @@ local function trigger(bufnr, clients)
   reset_timer()
   Context:cancel_pending()
 
-  if tonumber(vim.fn.pumvisible()) == 1 and not Context.isIncomplete then
+  if tonumber(vim.fn.pumvisible()) == 1 then

comment_data.body:
> (e.g. remove previous results for client-2, add new results for client-2, but keep results from client-1)

Can do in C side I prefer to do a soft delete here, that is, set an unavailable flag in the compl_T structure. Otherwise, there will be some memory allocation efficiency issues.

> Independent of that, do I understand it right that this PR is otherwise good to go?

I changed isInComplete to a table storing clientid. Do I need to revert to the original state? So far no tests have been broken. But maybe that means no catch.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -441,7 +445,7 @@ local function trigger(bufnr, clients)
   reset_timer()
   Context:cancel_pending()
 
-  if tonumber(vim.fn.pumvisible()) == 1 and not Context.isIncomplete then
+  if tonumber(vim.fn.pumvisible()) == 1 then

@@ -1220,4 +1244,104 @@ describe('vim.lsp.completion: integration', function()
       end)
     )
   end)
+
+  it('accept item.textEdit', function()
+    local completion_list = {
+      isIncomplete = true,
+      items = {
+        {
+          detail = 'handle_T',
+          filterText = 'handle',
+          insertText = '->handle',
+          insertTextFormat = 1,
+          kind = 5,
+          label = ' handle',
+          score = 0.43193808197975,
+          sortText = '4122d903handle',
+          textEdit = {
+            newText = '->handle',
+            range = {
+              ['end'] = {
+                character = 3,
+                line = 0,
+              },
+              start = {
+                character = 2,
+                line = 0,
+              },
+            },
+          },
+        },
+        {
+          detail = 'int',
+          filterText = 'w_alt_fnum',
+          insertText = '->w_alt_fnum',
+          insertTextFormat = 1,
+          kind = 5,
+          label = ' w_alt_fnum',
+          score = 0.43193808197975,
+          sortText = '4122d903w_alt_fnum',
+          textEdit = {
+            newText = '->w_alt_fnum',
+            range = {
+              ['end'] = {
+                character = 3,
+                line = 0,
+              },
+              start = {
+                character = 2,
+                line = 0,
+              },
+            },
+          },
+        },
+        {
+          detail = 'int',
+          filterText = 'w_arg_idx',
+          insertText = '->w_arg_idx',
+          insertTextFormat = 1,
+          kind = 5,
+          label = ' w_arg_idx',
+          score = 0.43193808197975,
+          sortText = '4122d903w_arg_idx',
+          textEdit = {
+            newText = '->w_arg_idx',
+            range = {
+              ['end'] = {
+                character = 3,
+                line = 0,
+              },
+              start = {
+                character = 2,
+                line = 0,
+              },
+            },
+          },
+        },
+      },
+    }
+    exec_lua(function()
+      vim.o.completeopt = 'menu,menuone,noinsert'
+    end)
+    create_server('dummy', completion_list)
+
+    feed('iwp.<c-x><c-o>')
+    retry(nil, nil, function()
+      eq(
+        1,
+        exec_lua(function()
+          return vim.fn.pumvisible()
+        end)
+      )
+    end)
+
+    -- accept textEdit
+    feed('<C-y>')
+    eq(
+      { 'wp->handle', { 1, 10 } },
+      exec_lua(function()
+        return { vim.api.nvim_get_current_line(), vim.api.nvim_win_get_cursor(0) }
+      end)
+    )
+  end)

comment_data.body: emm This should be irrelevant to this PR. I think you need to manually set iskeyword to infer word boundaries

comment_data.body:
I didn't sure if the scope of this PR covers it but wanted to avoid next human mistake so finally wrote that case. 

Extending `isk` has too much unwanted side effects - maybe we need some extended way to determine completion word boundaries (user defined callback?), where `isk` could be used as a fallback.

+    feed('<C-y>')
+    eq(
+      { 'wp->handle', { 1, 10 } },
+      exec_lua(function()
+        return { vim.api.nvim_get_current_line(), vim.api.nvim_win_get_cursor(0) }
+      end)
+    )
+  end)

comment_data.body:
Hm, I lost idea what could be done both in my particular case and in general - probably I need some time to sort out that topic (offtopic here).

I noticed sideways that `iskeyword` buffer scope can be too wide if could use a value specific to injected language. Maybe we need something like `iskeywordexpr` (keeping compatibility with Vim, although not sure if usable in any way there) that could be context aware. 

Thanks for precising the PR title.

comment_data.body: Here we should use col after the trigger symbol to prevent the trigger from being included in compl_leader. For example, `wp.` points to col 7 (1-based) and we should use 8 as the last start_col, and compl_col in C is 7 (0based). This way, `.` will not be included in compl_leader. Otherwise ins_compl_build_pum will fail because cp_str does not contain the prefix.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -512,7 +522,10 @@ local function trigger(bufnr, clients)
         vim.list_extend(matches, client_matches)
       end
     end
-    local start_col = (server_start_boundary or word_boundary) + 1
+    if #matches == 0 then
+      return
+    end
+    local start_col = math.max(server_start_boundary or 0, word_boundary) + 1

comment_data.body: Since the current omni calls trigger internally and then calls compelete, the cursor should be kept available without being cleaned up with complete_type check which i implement in  https://github.com/neovim/neovim/pull/31455

       buffer = bufnr,
       callback = function()
         local reason = api.nvim_get_vvar('event').reason --- @type string
+        local type = api.nvim_get_vvar('event').complete_type --- @type string
         if reason == 'accept' then
           on_complete_done()
+        elseif not Context.keep_cursor and type ~= 'omni' then

comment_regular_data.body: i haven't look at  #30905  but i will check it later. now the fu can expand correctly

> now the fu can expand correctly

Works for me too, thanks
For some reason I cannot get completion result on `vim.api.` with LuaLs whilst I have no problem on master with it. If you cannot reproduce it, I can try to provide some example.
I can't reproduce do you have mutliple clients on lua file ?

Yes, there is none-ls providing completion too, but even after stopping it I still cannot get that list. 

I may have no time to prepare repro now, but see that the luals completion works if Nvim starts without none-ls.
Okay, I reverted the change of isInComplete. Maybe I can reprocess it after extending complete_add.

> Okay, I reverted the change of isInComplete. Maybe I can reprocess it after extending complete_add.

Now I see results again with two completion providers :+1:

Confirmed for lemminx (while `<` does not belong to `iskeyword`). 

The repro from [the comment above](https://github.com/neovim/neovim/pull/32142#issuecomment-2638328431) also shows that (on insertText).

![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/d850e5d8-fc75-4788-a919-45848132d1e9)

how about now ? problem is that when isInComplete is true, the result of the subsequent input request needs to be checked against the input. Currently, the col of line sub is truncated from the initial completion position. This results in the inclusion of extra characters. we can use Context.cursor now which have value from multiple insexpand PR. so just check it for subsequent request no need change startcol

Now it's ok at least on my repro and lemminx. Both have single completion provider. 

For two providers I still get incorrectly recognized start of word but if I understood, at the moment (after [0efb2c4](https://github.com/neovim/neovim/commit/0efb2c4a81f32b2563dcf159e5b2ce08d1fbb611)) that case fell out of scope of this PR, is that right?
...and again completion on luals fails with none-ls. Maybe we need to add a test that covers such case here.

emmm I don't modified `isInComplete` just change the prefix value when context.cursor have value ..how can i reproduce it ? i don' use none-ls. at least it works fine when i use `phoenix` a server which provider path/word a fake lsp and luals . how none-ls handle completion request?

I'll then try to create repro with two completion in free time, maybe with looking how none-ls (especially its adapter I wrote and use) does it. You can look [there](https://github.com/nvimtools/none-ls.nvim/blob/main/lua/null-ls/builtins/completion/nvim_snippets.lua) before - maybe you'll find something specific sooner than me.

Aha i know what happen here. seems like Context.cursor does not reset when complete done.. @mfussenegger ~~when we trigger completedone there still need reset Context.cursor and timer right that mean calling `on_insert_leave` in CompleteDone~~ not correct ..  found a new way to solve. update later

Thanks. Now lemminx, ~my recent repro~ and completion list works. Only double providers require fix, still not sure if in this PR (and I sitll have a plan to prepare some minimal example for that, without none-ls).
yep because i reverted a change yesterday. should be works fine now.
Do we have `vim.lsp.completion.trigger()` tests that check candiates (`insertText`) with whitespace (and multilines)? E.g. `foo bar`, and `foo bar\nbaz buz\n`.
reproduced..please wait for a while..
Hm, did you include fix in the recent big commit that merges master into this PR? Currently I cannot reproduce that bug.

Yes it solves the problem temporarily. But I have an autocomplete script that does it at every character. If Context.cursor is not cleaned it won't work.

```lua
    api.nvim_create_autocmd(InsertCharPre, {
      buffer = bufnr,
      group = g,
      callback = function()
        if tonumber(pumvisible()) == 1 then
          return
        end
        local triggerchars = vim.tbl_get(
          client,
          'server_capabilities',
          'completionProvider',
          'triggerCharacters'
        ) or {}
        if vim.v.char:match('[%w_]') and not vim.list_contains(triggerchars, vim.v.char) then
          vim.schedule(function()
            completion.trigger()
          end)
        end
      end,
      desc = 'completion on character which not exist in lsp client triggerCharacters',
    })
```

> Do we have `vim.lsp.completion.trigger()` tests that check candiates (`insertText`) with whitespace (and multilines)? E.g. `foo bar`, and `foo bar\nbaz buz\n`.
